title: Great Britain and Chicago Bulls legend Luol Deng announces retirement from NBA
text:
Great Britain international Luol Deng has announced his retirement from the NBA.

The 34-year-old signed a symbolic one-day contract with the Chicago Bulls to allow him to retire as a member of the team where he played the majority of his career after being drafted as the seventh overall pick in 2004.

The Bulls' executive vice president of basketball operations, John Paxson, told NBA.com: 'From the moment we made Luol Deng the seventh overall pick of the 2004 NBA Draft, the Chicago Bulls became a better team.

Luol Deng has retired from basketball after signing a symbolic contract with the Chicago Bulls

'We'll always remember his All-Star career and the fierce competitiveness he brought.'

Deng retires as the Bulls' fourth-leading scorer of all time with 10,286 points and also ranks in the franchise's top 10 for a host of offensive and defensive statistics.

He led them in scoring in both the 2011-12 and 2012-13 seasons and was selected to the league's All-Star team on both occasions.

Born in South Sudan, the 6ft 9in forward represented Great Britain for several years.

He scored 838 points in 43 appearances, playing in two EuroBasket finals as well as the London 2012 Olympics.
description: Great Britain international Luol Deng has announced his retirement from the NBA. The 34-year-old signed a symbolic contract with the Chicago Bulls to allow him to retire as a member of the team.
